person_or_org.name: Marek Pawel Bargiel, Marek Pawel Bargiel

metadata.description:
This work presents a falsifiable cosmological model in which the Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) arises not from primordial quantum fluctuations or inflation, but from recursive radiation emitted by a hierarchy of geometrically defined causal horizon surfaces. 

The model reproduces the Planckian envelope of the CMB without invoking inflation, particle-based singularities, or initial scalar field perturbations. It introduces natural damping (Silk-like suppression) via an exponential cutoff at high wavenumbers, derived from geometric shear and horizon depth rather than baryon-photon interactions.

 

Furthermore, the model generates E-mode polarization and TE cross-correlation from recursive surface shear rather than Thomson scattering, producing all primary anisotropy spectra (CTTₗ, CEEₗ, CTEₗ) in agreement with Planck 2018 data. Simulations yield residuals within observational uncertainty across the full multipole range.

 

This paper is a companion validation and extract of the complete Recursive Horizon Theory (a proposed Theory of Everything), focusing specifically on the observable CMB structure and radiation origin. All equations, numerical fit methods, and observational comparisons are included. No free parameters are tuned beyond the recursion depth and entropy geometry derived from the core theory.

metadata.title: Genesis of horizon

metadata.description: A community of people with broad interdisciplinary interests, focused on developing a ToE, based on the Geometric Unity Theory (GUT) and spacetime as a self-intersecting Möbius strip in 5 dimensions.
metadata.title: Unus Mundus - Theory of Everything
